title: Pandas: Selecting Columns
story: Extract specific columns from a DataFrame. You can select single columns or multiple columns at once.
instructions: Given a DataFrame with columns 'product', 'price', 'quantity', select only the 'product' and 'price' columns. Print the result.
starterCode:
import pandas as pd

# Sample data
data = {
    'product': ['Apple', 'Banana', 'Orange'],
    'price': [1.2, 0.5, 0.8],
    'quantity': [10, 20, 15]
}
df = pd.DataFrame(data)

# Select specific columns
result = df[['product', 'price']]
print(result)
solutionHidden:
import pandas as pd

data = {
    'product': ['Apple', 'Banana', 'Orange'],
    'price': [1.2, 0.5, 0.8],
    'quantity': [10, 20, 15]
}
df = pd.DataFrame(data)
result = df[['product', 'price']]
print(result)

tests.description: Should select and print product and price columns only

hints.text: Use double brackets for multiple columns: df[['col1', 'col2']]
